body:
Comment 7: 
Maybe append should modify the slice triplet, instead of adding documentation?

Currently to ensure that your program works (visibly) correctly you must always assign
it back to the same variable anyway. So passing pointer to the triplet seems to be a
better option.

I'm currently trying to imagine, why documentation change should be preferred. So far
the only reason I can think of is that it's a builtin function and people are used to
it. Are there some other reasons why append shouldn't be changed?
